results.title: Motivation: the classic concepts (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Underwood, Janice M Reynolds and CRM Productions
results.brief_description: Presents five classic work motivation theories: McGregor’s Theory X and Theory Y, Maslow’s need hierarchy, Hertzberg’s “hygiene’s” and “motivators”, McClellands motivational profiles and Skinner’s behaviour reinforcement. Illustrates that humans are motivated by a complex set of factors including money, the need for achievement and the desire for meaningful work.

results.title: Motivating people in today's workplace
results.brief_description: This is an audiocassette seminar led by Mickey Kinder. How do you get people excited about working - when their work isn’t all that exciting? This is one of the toughest challenges facing managers. Ultimately the organisations success depends on an interested, motivated staff. This audio program describes motivational strategies that get results from inspiring staff from within. Some of the skills you will learn include; motivational strategies for specific situations, including self-directed teams, how to keep spirits high during down-sizing, how to start new employees off on the right foot, and how to recognise the needs of current employees. Looks at motivational theories to explain the types of motivation available and the situations in which they do or do not work.

results.title: Motion pictures. 1st 20 years. Part 2: 1903-1904
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures produced by Thomas A. Edison, photography by Edwin S. Porter.
Contents: Uncle Tom’s cabin (1903)—The Gay shoe clerk (1903)—A Romance of the rail (1903)—Rounding up of the ‘Yeggmen’ (1904)
Films restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.

results.title: Motion pictures produced in Great Britain 1903-1905
results.brief_description:
A compilation of early silent motion pictures produced in Great Britain by Clarendon, Gaumont and Hepworth.
Contents: How this old woman caught the omnibus (1903)—The Eviction (1904)—The Bewitched traveller (1904)—An Englishman’s trip to Paris from London (1904)—The Lover’s ruse (1904)—A Race for a kiss (1904)—The Other side of the hedge (1904)—Fine feathers make fine birds (1905)
Copyrighted by American Mutoscope and Biograph Company - films restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.

results.title: Motion pictures produced by George Melies 1903-1904
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures produced and directed by French filmmaker George Melies and restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.
Contents: The Inn where no man rests (1903)—A Spiritualist photographer (1903)—The Kingdom of the fairies (1903)—The Magic lantern (1903)—The Clockmaker’s dream (1904)—The Cook in trouble (1904)—The Mermaid (1904)
